abstract: Under the rescue plan WestLB’s owners agreed to guarantee a new off-balance-sheet unit that would house about 23 billion euros ($33 billion) of risky securities.
snippet: Under the rescue plan WestLB’s owners agreed to guarantee a new off-balance-sheet unit that would house about 23 billion euros ($33 billion) of risky securities.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  WestLB, a state-owned German bank, said Friday that it would reduce its work force by 25 percent and receive 5 billion euros ($7.2 billion) from its owners to cover losses tied to bad trades and the subprime mortgage market.

headline.print_headline: Hurt by Subprime Problems, German Bank Gets Bailout
